means: 栖息处( perch的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: There is a trend for knocking public-school headmasters and headmistresses off their perches.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在有一种推翻公立学校校长权威性的趋势。

sentence.Network_en: Other protection can be obtained by providing wooden perches througout the orchards.
sentence.Network_cn: 其它保护措施是可在种子园中到处设置木制的栖木.

sentence.Network_en: The birds were hopping about on their perches and twittering.
sentence.Network_cn: 鸟儿在栖木上跳来跳去,吱吱地叫着.

PerfectNetExp.abs: All the hens came down from their perches , and began to look for their food ., 于是所有的母鸡都从栖息处走出来觅食.

黄鲈 (Yellow Perch). 冰下钓上的鱼比夏天好吃得多, 味鲜甜. -cacc(CACC); 2005.12.25 13:55 (110 bytes. #2680876)Good Size. -fly.

entry.def: If you perch on something, you sit down lightly on the very edge or tip of it.

example.ex: He lit a cigarette and perched on the corner of the desk...
example.tran: 他点了一根烟，坐在桌角上。

example.ex: He perched himself on the side of the bed.

entry.def: To perch somewhere means to be on  the top or edge of something.

example.ex: ...the vast slums that perch precariously on top of the hills around which the city was built.
example.tran: 坐落在城市周围的山峰上、摇摇欲坠的贫民窟

entry.tran: 把…置于；使立稳于…的边缘（或顶部）
entry.def: If you perch something on something else, you put or balance it on the top or edge of that thing.

example.ex: The builders have perched a light concrete dome on eight slender columns.
example.tran: 建筑工人在8根细柱上架起轻巧的混凝土穹顶。

entry.def: When a bird perches on something such as a branch or a wall, it lands on it and stands there.

example.ex: A blackbird flew down and perched on the parapet outside his window.
example.tran: 一只乌鸫飞下来，停在他窗外的矮墙上。

entry.def: A perch is a short rod for a bird to stand on.
You can refer to a high place where someone is sitting as their perch .
If someone is knocked off their perch, they are no longer admired or no longer thought of as important or clever.

example.ex: There is a trend for knocking public-school headmasters and headmistresses off their perches.
example.tran: 现在有一种推翻公立学校校长权威性的趋势。

entry.def: A perch is an edible fish. There are several kinds of perch.

auth_sentence.content: The kestrels have got lots of perches round here.
auth_sentence.res_content: The kestrels have got lots of perches round here.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The kestrels have got lots of perches round here.

auth_sentence.content: But it now perches precariously over a watery pit.
auth_sentence.res_content: But it now perches precariously over a watery pit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But it now perches precariously over a watery pit.

auth_sentence.content: The seagull perches on the roof.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The seagull perches on the roof.
